thread.section_title: Spy camera found hidden above toilet in Starbucks – Metro
thread.title: Spy camera found hidden above toilet in Starbucks
thread.title_full: Spy camera found hidden above toilet in Starbucks

posts.author: ashithanagesh
posts.title: Spy camera found hidden above toilet in Starbucks
posts.text:
The Starbucks is in Vauxhall, south London (Picture: Creative Commons) A covert camera was found hidden in the vent above a Starbucks customer toilet. 
The small recording device was discovered hidden above the loo in the chain’s Vauxhall branch in south London – right opposite MI6’s headquarters.
Ricci Arcari, a 33-year-old from the area who is a regular at that Starbucks, found the device and tweeted footage showing it hidden in the grille – adding that he was ‘totally disgusted’.
@Starbucks whilst using the loo. I found a recording device above the loo in Starbucks Vauxhall. Told manager and police. Pls contact me pic.twitter.com/gGMzDHLhQT 
— Ricci Arcari (@riccibryson) November 23, 2016 

‘I panicked a little bit, stopped what I was doing, closed the toilet lid and jumped up to have a look,’ he told the Evening Standard .
Man arrested for deliberately infecting people with HIV goes on the run ‘I wanted to make sure it was what it was so I poked and prodded it a few times with my pinky and ran out and got the manager.’
The toilet at the branch is one of the large unisex ones that is for use by everyone.
Responding to his tweet, the Met Police said they were ‘aware’ of the camera and ‘a police car has been assigned’.
@riccibryson Hi We are aware and a police car has been assigned. Many thanks
— Met Contact Centre (@MetCC) November 23, 2016 

And a police spokesperson told Metro.co.uk: ‘Officers in Lambeth Borough are investigating a report of a camera hidden in a public toilet at a coffee shop in Vauxhall. The discovery of the device was reported to police at around 19:45hrs on Tuesday, 22 November.
Newborn baby dies after being abandoned outside a vicarage ‘Officers attended the following morning and collected the device for forensic examination. There have been no arrests at present and enquiries continue.’
And a spokesperson for Starbucks told Metro.co.uk: ‘This is a distressing discovery for our partners (employees) and customers, and we take our responsibility to provide a safe environment very seriously.
‘As soon as the store was made aware of this, we removed the device and contacted the police who are investigating the incident.’
Anyone with any information is being asked to call police in Lambeth via 101. To give information anonymously Crimestoppers can be contacted on 0800 555 111 or by visiting crimestoppers-uk.org

thread.title: Starbucks Verismo System review – Coffee shop coffee at home
thread.title_full: Starbucks Verismo System review – Coffee shop coffee at home

posts.author: Joey Davidson
posts.title: Starbucks Verismo System review – Coffee shop coffee at home
posts.text:
The first generation of the Starbucks Verismo System was meant to give Starbucks fans a way to make the coffee they’re used to at home. It was met with some negative feedback from consumers.
So, Starbucks decided to try again with a second generation. The new Verismo System offers a much more competitive product, and I’d pick one up if I was a daily Starbucks diehard.
Great coffee and espresso engineered with an odd drawback Does this make good coffee? That’s the simple question here. Yes. It does. The coffee matches what’s sold in Starbucks, and I know that because I bought the same exact beverages I made at home and tried them side by side. The cappuccino from the Verismo system wasn’t quite the same, but both were of similar quality.
The coffee is brewed at the right temperature, though it dispenses 10oz at roughly 175º F. The brewing temperature seems right because of the spot-on flavor of the coffee. It’s neither too weak or burnt, and I’d guess that the internal brew put it much closer to 195º F. The system and proprietary Starbucks Verismo pods produce much better coffee than what you get from the Keurig, though that comes at an expense.
I couldn’t find the pods sold locally at any grocery stores near me in the Mid-Atlantic. My only option was online, and Starbucks sells them for, in the smallest amount, $12-13 for 12 pods. That’s more expensive than the competition, but it’s still cheaper than a Starbucks coffee shop.
On the whole, I admired the engineering behind the Verismo System’s Brewer. The rinse feature is brilliant, it produces large cups of coffee, espresso shots come out perfectly every single time and when pods are used they drop into a collection bin that’s housed within the unit. All of that is great, though multiple weeks of use brought up an odd drawback.
See full gallery on TechnoBuffalo Even with the cup holding tray removed, some travel mugs were too large to actually fit below the brewer. I had to either brew into a different mug or (I don’t recommend this) hold my mug off of the counter and move the brewer to a hanging position. The profile of the device is too low for some cups.
While it was easy to clean, Starbucks says that the way to properly deep clean the brewer is with special cleaning liquids. There’s no recommendation to simply brew with vinegar and water.
A milk frother that works well most of the time The milk frother can be purchased separately if you want the addition. It typically sells for $59, but it’s a necessity if you want to make lattes and cappuccinos with the System. It heats and froths milk, and it can do the frothing without heat if you want your drink iced or chilled.
It’s also easy to clean, though you’ll need to work the bottom of the frother to remove any milk film created with the heat. It froths quickly, but it is the longest part of the brewing process by far.
My only complaint with the frother comes from the produced texture. At times, it’s wetter than it should be when frothing for cappuccinos. I’d say it happens, perhaps, once out of every 10 uses, and I couldn’t pinpoint the reason for it.
There are cheaper frothers out there, so you don’t necessarily need the Starbucks version. It works well, though, and it’s priced competitively when compared to other heated frothers.
The Starbucks Verismo System fills a niche The Starbucks Verismo System sits right between the Keurig and coffee shops in price. The pods are more expensive than what the competition offers, but each cup of java, espresso or otherwise, is cheaper than what you’d find in an actual Starbucks.
If the system’s two biggest benefits are its ease of use and the relative quality of coffee, its biggest slight is the cost of pods. For an everyday Starbucks drinker, the Verismo System makes a whole lot of sense. You’ll get the Starbucks you crave at home for less money than you spend in stores.
See full gallery on TechnoBuffalo If you’re more of a frugal coffee drinker, like me, than the Verismo System will stand as an unnecessary expense. Which is totally okay. As strong as the system is, I don’t think it’s been designed or priced to be ultra competitive among consumers like me.
It is a novelty, though, and one that produces great coffee. I’ve had a cappuccino daily since having it in my house, and that’s been a great treat.
If you like Starbucks and don’t mind the extra price of the pods, the Verismo System is a well-engineered product that makes good coffee. It’s definitely more capable than the Keurig, so keep that in mind if you’re shopping for both.
Black Friday presents a great deal for the system The Verismo System is actually on sale right now, too. We received a note from the PR contact working with us in regards to the system. Here are the details.
From November 21 through December 25, customers can purchase the “Everyday Bundle” for $129 (regularly $179) at select Starbucks stores and on Verismo.com; This includes a Verismo® V Brewer, Verismo® Milk Frother and free 12-count box of Verismo® pods of your choice. Also available on Verismo.com. The Verismo® V Brewer is available for $99 (regularly $149) with a free 12-count box of Verismo® pods of choice, and the Verismo® Milk Frother is available for $39 (regularly $59). Also available on Verisimo.com. Those discounts make this system a strong option right now.
Disclaimer: We were loaned a Verismo System for review purposes. We also received four boxes of pods.

posts.author: Zacks Equity Research
posts.title: Starbucks' (SBUX) Initiatives Impress, Macro Woes Remain
posts.text:
Trades from $ 3 On Nov 22, we issued an updated research report on coffee chain giant Starbucks Corporation ( SBUX - Free Report ) .Starbucks’ shares have lost approximately 1.2% year to date due to several macro issues. Although the stock has partially recovered, it lags the broader market. Pros Starbucks is one of the most recognized coffee brands in the world. From espresso to specialty roast and ground coffee to premium single-serve market, Starbucks enjoys a leading position in all coffee segments. It is the number one premium packaged coffee brand in America. Further, management focuses on increasing its global market share through store openings in new and existing markets, remodeling of existing stores, deploying technology, controlling costs and aggressive product innovation and brand building.Recently, Starbucks concluded fiscal 2016 on a solid note. The company reported better-than-expected results in the fourth quarter with earnings and revenues increasing 30.2% and 16% year over year, respectively, buoyed by strong sales and margin expansion (up 180 basis points or bps). Higher sales in the U.S. and China/Asia Pacific division have counterbalanced a slowdown in the Europe, Middle East, and Africa (“EMEA”) segment.Starbucks is working on technological innovation to strengthen its brand, improve efficiency and in-store execution and boost profits. Its Mobile Order & Pay service now represents nearly 6% of the total U.S. transactions as of Oct 2, 2016, up from 5% in the prior quarter.The Mobile Order & Pay service allows customers to order before arriving at a Starbucks café and pick up the items at the store, thus saving on time. The service is witnessing increased usage and could prove to be a key growth driver going ahead. Starbucks has also deployed the facility in many of its stores in the U.K. and Canada with plans to continue rolling out the platform in key international markets.Again, Starbucks’ Channel Development or CPG business has become a fast growing and highly profitable business. This segment’s operating margin rose 390 bps in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2016. Cons Economic, geopolitical and consumer headwinds continue to impact Starbucks’ results. Meanwhile, the company’s EMEA segment has been experiencing sluggish performance. During the fourth quarter, Starbucks posted negative 1% comp growth in the EMEA region and a 12% decline in revenues due to the ongoing macro and consumer challenges, and a shift toward more licensed stores along with currency headwinds. Comparable store sales or comps were flat in fiscal 2016 versus 4% growth in fiscal 2015.In Europe, economic/political conditions are anticipated to be challenging after U.K.’s exit from the 28-member economic bloc. As it is, business in Europe is clouded by the economic uncertainties in the Northern region and deflation in the Eurozone.High inflation rates and currency devaluation are hurting sales in Latin America, especially Brazil and Argentina. Moreover, the slowing down of the Chinese economy and concerns about Japan, owing to a weaker yen and tax increases, are adding to the restaurateurs’ woes. Zacks Rank & Key Picks Starbucks carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). Better-ranked stocks in the restaurant space include The Cheesecake Factory Incorporated ( CAKE - Free Report ) , Darden Restaurants, Inc. ( DRI - Free Report ) and McDonald's Corporation ( MCD - Free Report ) .All three companies carry a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy). You can see the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks here .Darden Restaurants’ current year growth rate is pegged at 10.9% while that for Cheesecake Factory is 19.5% and McDonald’s is 14%. thread.title: 'Pokemon Go Generation 2' rumors, release date news: Niantic is partnering with Starbucks?
thread.title_full: 'Pokemon Go Generation 2' rumors, release date news: Niantic is partnering with Starbucks?

posts.title: 'Pokemon Go Generation 2' rumors, release date news: Niantic is partnering with Starbucks?
posts.text:
(Facebook/ Pokemon) Promotional image for "Pokemon Go" 
The most recent rumors regarding the possible arrival of "Pokemon Go's" second generation are surprisingly hinting at a potential partnership between Starbucks and Pokemon. The leaked information allegedly came from a Starbucks staff who received a written internal memo detailing the upcoming "Pokemon Frapuccino" and its alleged release date. 
The document outlines some of the promotional activities that Starbucks will undertake for the months of November and December. The series of events will culminate with the launching of the "Pokemon Version 2" on Dec. 7. 
There is also mention of lures that will be made available at all Starbucks stores some time between January to February. However, there is no telling if the said document is authentic. It is not enough to confirm an actual partnership and the arrival of a new version of the game. 
The possible partnership with Starbucks is most likely a strategy to attract players back to the game. Just recently, "Pokemon Go" released a Halloween and Thanksgiving event together with new spawn locations and daily bonuses that apparently worked in terms of luring players back to the game. Advertisement 
The game experienced a dip a few months back that compelled its developer, Niantic, to come up with something new to create momentum again. 
Nevertheless, some gaming fans are inclined to believe the alleged leak may be true. It will come as no surprise to them at all if new Pokemon characters start appearing near Starbucks stores when Dec. 7 arrives. 
Only then will fans be able to affirm that the Starbucks staff who posted the document was indeed telling the truth. At present, the Reddit post has already been removed and what remains are the comments that some users posted. Both Niantic and Starbucks have yet to comment on the supposed partnership. 
As for the much-anticipated second generation of "Pokemon Go," there is no formal announcement released from the game developers yet. Should it arrive anytime soon, Niantic will surely make initial announcements for the benefit of the game's avid followers.

thread.title: How Starbucks Harnesses Creative Collaboration
thread.title_full: How Starbucks Harnesses Creative Collaboration

posts.author: Bryn Mooth
posts.title: How Starbucks Harnesses Creative Collaboration
posts.text:
Bryn Mooth | November 23, 2016 
Think YOU have a challenging workload? Every two months, Starbucks launches a new in-store promotion in more than 23,000 stores around the world. All-new design concepts, all-new creative output … every eight weeks … 52 weeks a year. The work doesn’t stop. 
How does the Starbucks creative team pull it off? Collaboration is the key. And they’ll talk about how it all happens at HOW Design Live . Dena Blevins, Creative Director Global Promotions & Brand will head up a panel discussion with her Starbucks colleagues, Account Director Melissa Bush, Creative Director Steve Murray, VP Jeffrey Fields and VP Nancy Poznoff titled Building a Strong Brand Through Collaboration . 
As the brand shifts its seasonal look from a “Pumpkin Spice” fall theme to wintery holiday imagery, we asked Blevins about what it’s like to maintain creative energy amid a constant workflow and how collaboration is key. She describes the office as fast-moving, busy and intense — but “we play nice,” Blevins says. “We have a lot of respect and love for each other.” 
Throughout the studio area, she says, you’ll find artists and designers painting, sketching, printing, creating all the artwork for promotions, packaging and products. Each season brings a new aesthetic to the Starbucks look. And, as you might expect, there’s coffee. Lots of it. Coffee stations in every aisle, with grinders, scales, gadgets to make the perfect pour-over cup. “It smells amazing!” Blevins raves. Part of a summer campaign to promote new and old flavors of the customer-favorite Frappuccino 
How is the company’s creative function organized? Roughly how many creative staffers work there, and how is the team structured? The Starbucks Global Creative studio is part of the marketing organization. We have a team of about 160 — composed of talented designers, writers, illustrators, pre-press specialists and producers. The creative team is divided into two main groups that report into two Vice Presidents that support different aspects of the business. One VP supports advertising, brand, promotional work, and visual merchandising. The other VP supports merchandise design, packaging, Starbucks Reserve & Roastery. One thing to note too, this work includes our other brands as well: Teavana, Evolution Fresh and Tazo. 
Tell us about your team’s work — I assume that you touch EVERYTHING, from coffee sleeves to seasonal store decor to merchandise. Yes, my team supports the brand work and all of the in-store promotional work you see in our stores around the world. I have one team that supports brand work, two teams that support promotional work for retail North America, one team that supports international promotions, and one team that supports Teavana promotions. In promotions, there are certain times of the year that the we affect almost everything in our stores — specifically our annual holiday promotion. The store signage completely flips: everything from menus, to banners, to our shopping bags, and most importantly our iconic red cups that signal the beginning of the holiday season. Every year, I am so proud of the work our studio produces. Every year I feel like it is our best work ever — and I feel that way again right now. Our holiday promotion just launched in our stores, our red cups are being carried in customer’s hands around the world — it is really incredible! I love my job. Above and below: Part of Starbucks fall campaign celebrating all things autumnal; artist Victor Melendez created the seasonal illustrations 
The theme of your panel presentation is collaboration — how does your team embrace a culture of collaboration? And how does that enable you to produce the enormous volume of work you do? Yes, collaboration is so key. Working in our creative studio here is very different than my experience working at a typical ad agency. We collaborate across functions and across teams. We have our “clients” down the hall, our marketing partners, and we’re all equally passionate about the brand, and doing what’s right for our brand. We think long term, not short term, and consider how the decisions we make affect every aspect of our business. Will it resonate with our customers? Does it elevate our brand? Does it make our partners (baristas) proud? Starbucks commissioned Seattle artist Shogo Ota to create an illustration (a single line) on the windows for its flagship stores in NYC and Seattle; he also illustrated a limited-edition green cup to signify human connection 
What’s your team’s biggest challenge, and how do you work to overcome it? Timelines. As a company, we try to be nimble, and make shifts in strategies and businesses as needed — and that can cause timelines to get crunched. So, our biggest challenge is trying to do our best work in the time allowed. That can lead to pulling in people from other teams to help out—again, that’s the importance of collaboration. We divide and conquer. Once our work is out in the world, it is truly a team effort. 
Even if you don’t work with a brand as massive as Starbucks, you can learn from the team’s experience about how to manage your project load, how to work with colleagues and how to stay inspired year ’round. Hear from creatives from Starbucks and other leading brands including Coca-Cola, Hallmark, GE and more at HOW Design Live 2017 . Check out the amazing lineup of speakers , browse the full conference program and choose your own ideal agenda.

ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. (KRQE) – Albuquerque police responding to several Starbucks locations throughout the city.
A source has told KRQE News 13 they’re investigating small devices being left behind and suspects possibly shooting at the locations.
The Albuquerque Police Department was on scene at the Starbucks on Lomas and Washington as well as the Starbucks on San Mateo and Gibson.
Roads were blocked off for some time in both areas.
We’re waiting to hear back from APD officials to confirm this information.

thread.title: Global Instant Coffee Market 2016-2020
thread.title_full: Global Instant Coffee Market 2016-2020

posts.author: Technavio
posts.title: Global Instant Coffee Market 2016-2020
posts.text:
SKU: IRTNTR10924   report identifies players like JDE, Keurig Green Mountain, Nestlé, and Starbucks to be the key vendors in the global instant coffee market. This research report also presents a detailed segmentation of the market by product (spray-drying, and freeze-drying), distribution channel (department stores, hypermarkets, and supermarkets, convenience stores, specialty stores, and online retail), and by geography (the Americas, APAC, Europe, and MEA). Overview of the global instant coffee market Technavio’s market research analyst predicts the global instant coffee market to grow at a CAGR of almost 6% between 2016 and 2020. Changing lifestyle and consumption patterns of time-pressed consumers are increasing the demand for coffee . The convenient preparation of instant coffee and its availability in multiple flavors and formats are the most significant factors driving growth in this market. Also, the shelf life of instant coffee is longer than that of ground coffee because it is in a powder texture. Several well-known coffee brands are marketing instant coffees as specialty coffees, which has widened the scope for this market. For instance, Nestlé has come up with a Barista style instant coffee, Azera. Starbucks has also introduced many different flavors for consumers. Some manufacturers are making constant innovations in the product segment in terms of aroma, flavor, and color of instant coffee, which will inevitably attract more consumers. In terms of geography, Europe accounts for the largest share in the global market where the UK, Turkey, Belarus, and Ukraine are the leading instant coffee-consuming countries. The region depends mainly on imports to meet the growing demand as the harsh climatic conditions restricts the cultivation of coffee. Russia is the most prominent market for instant coffee, and the easy availability of three-in-one coffee sachets are propelling more consumption among contemporary Russian consumers. With several manufacturers setting up instant coffee-based vending machines in convenience stores, offices, and high-traffic public areas, the market in Europe will witness huge growth in the coming years.   The global instant coffee market is extremely fragmented and comprises multiple players. The market is expected to witness a sizable increase in the production capacity as several market suppliers are focusing on technological advancements in producing instant coffee. A surge in the production volume will enable vendors to meet the constantly growing demand for instant coffee. This market is primarily dominated by the key players who are acquiring new brands to maintain their dominance in the global instant coffee market. 
Leading vendors in the market are - JDE Nestlé Starbucks Other prominent vendors in the instant coffee market include AJINOMOTO GENERAL FOODS, AMT Coffee, COLCAFÉ S.A.S. - INDUSTRIA COLOMBIANA DE CAFÉ, InterNatural Foods, The J.M. Smucker Company, Kraft Heinz, Lavazza, Strauss Coffee, Tata Coffee, Tchibo Coffee, and Trung Nguyen. Product segmentation and analysis of the instant coffee market Spray-drying Freeze-drying The global instant coffee market is dominated by the spray-drying segment, which will continue to dominate the market during the forecast period. Spray-drying instant coffee is common among most coffee manufacturers owing to its powdered texture that can be quickly dissolved in hot water or milk. Its easy preparation method and cost-effectiveness make spray-drying instant coffee more preferable among the busy consumers. Segmentation by distribution channel and analysis of the instant coffee market Department stores, hypermarkets, and supermarkets Convenience stores Specialty stores Online retail Department stores, hypermarkets, and supermarkets dominate the global instant coffee market, in terms of sales. The growing retail industry and the opening of numerous retail outlets across the globe are the major factors contributing to the growth of this channel. Also, consumers prefer these retail formats as they offer a wide assortment of products under one roof. The presence of numerous options is also an important driving force in the growth of this segment. Kohl's, Walmart, and Tesco are some of the popular retail outlets offering a broad range of instant coffee. Key questions answered in the report include What will the market size and the growth rate be in 2020? What are the key factors driving the global instant coffee market? What are the key market trends impacting the growth of the global instant coffee market? What are the challenges to market growth? Who are the key vendors in the global instant coffee market? What are the market opportunities and threats faced by the vendors in the global instant coffee market? Trending factors influencing the market shares of the Americas, APAC, Europe, and MEA. thread.title: Let’s Wink to the War on Christmas
thread.title_full: Let’s Wink to the War on Christmas

posts.author: Hrafnkell Haraldsson
posts.title: Let’s Wink to the War on Christmas
posts.text:
By Hrafnkell Haraldsson on Fri, Nov 25th, 2016 at 9:25 am "Unless a Starbucks cup is A) Threatening to murder you & B) Somehow seems to have the ability to do so Then some of you are overreacting Share on Twitter Print This Post 
Thanksgiving wasn’t even over yet when Newsweek’s Kurt Eichenwald tweeted , 
“Thanksgiving is mostly over. So I am officially launching the media war on Christmas. Let’s meet at George soros’s home to gather weaponry.” 
I’m a Pagan and it was our holiday first, but alright, let’s play. After all, as the retail industry has proved, again and again, you can never start early enough. So Hooah ! 
Starbucks is there already. They unveiled their new green holiday cup on November 1. Who can forget the red holiday cup controversy of 2015 , the infamous “Satan Sippers”? 
(This author has one in his collection. My local Starbucks told me the brouhaha had made them collector’s items. Gets yours early as a symbol of whatever, or just as a sign that you’re thirsty.) 
According to Starbucks, 
“The green cup and the design represent the connections Starbucks has as a community with its partners (employees) and customers. During a divisive time in our country, Starbucks wanted to create a symbol of unity as a reminder of our shared values, and the need to be good to each other,” said Howard Schultz, chairman and CEO. 
Awe. Well, that’s just so hateful. What about baby Jesus? 
CNN’s MoneyStream senior editor David Goldman winks at us with the answer : Starbucks' new holiday cups are green, because Starbucks hates baby Jesus #waronchristmas https://t.co/l871MWBvv0 pic.twitter.com/GKuKUHkqxB 
— David Goldman (@DavidGoldmanCNN) November 1, 2016 
Yes. Editors are paid to know these things. 
Esquire’s Matt Miller humorously observes that, 
“Confusingly enough, some seem to believe that the red (which did not represent Christmas last year), should be brought back to these green cups to make them more Christmas-y.” 
Oh dear. 
It’s a cup. You drink out of it. You don’t hang it from your tree unless you’re celebrating the birth of coffee. As Katherine Timpf of The National Review and Fox News put it in response to the fuss over the new green cup, Unless a Starbucks cup is 
A) Threatening to murder you &B) Somehow seems to have the ability to do so 
Then some of you are overreacting 
— Katherine Timpf (@KatTimpf) November 2, 2016 
With all the green and red being flashed around this time of the year, the idea that because a cup is red or green somebody hates Jesus is as absurd as the idea that Donald Trump is an honest man.

posts.author: Nicole Perez / Journal Staff Writer
posts.title: FBI, APD investigating string of early morning vandalism at local Starbucks shops | Albuquerque Journal
posts.text:
ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. — The FBI and Albuquerque police are looking for a suspected vandal who they believe broke into three Starbucks coffee shops early Friday morning and left “suspicious devices” inside.
Authorities haven’t released any details about what those devices were. FBI spokesman Frank Fisher said one of them “caused minimal damage” to one of the stores.
“Nobody was injured,” he said.
The store that was minimally damaged was the Starbucks in Nob Hill at Central and Tulane. Another store near Gibson and San Mateo was also vandalized, while the third vandalized store was at Lomas and Washington.
Images from surveillance footage released by the FBI show the suspect at the Starbucks on Lomas. Fisher asked anyone with information to call the FBI at 505-889-1300.
— This is a developing story. More information will be added as it becomes available.

posts.text:
ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. (AP) — Three Starbucks locations in New Mexico's most populous city were cordoned off and surrounded by police vehicles early Friday as federal and local authorities investigated reports of vandalism at the coffee shops.
Suspicious devices were placed inside the stores sometime after midnight, and one of them caused minimal damage, FBI spokesman Frank Fisher said. The shops were closed at the time, and no one was injured.
Fisher did not provide any details about the devices but noted that the Bureau of Alcohol , Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives was helping investigate.
Starbucks said in an email Friday that its local team was working with law enforcement. Company officials confirmed what they understood to be arson at the three stores but they were still waiting for more details.
"We are relieved there are no reported injuries," the statement said.
At least one of the stores had opened its drive-thru to customers in the morning as shoppers fanned out across the city for Black Friday, one of the busiest shopping days of the year.
One of the locations was along historic Route 66 in Albuquerque's Nob Hill neighborhood. The other two were just a few miles away.
Authorities released an image from a security camera at one of the stores showing a suspect entering as broken glass from the shattered front door covered the entrance. The suspect was dressed in dark clothing and appeared to be holding something.
Authorities were asking anyone with information about the incidents to call the FBI in New Mexico or submit tips online .

posts.author: Chelo Rivera
posts.title: Feds, police investigate vandalism at 3 Starbucks locations
posts.text:
Click to share on Pinterest (Opens in new window) 
ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. (KRQE) – The FBI and multiple agencies are still on the scene at the Starbucks in Nob Hill. Officers responded just after midnight to various Starbucks locations to reports of suspicious devices and vandalism. 
The Albuquerque Police Department has confirmed three separate devices detonated at three different Starbucks locations throughout the city early Friday morning. 
A picture just released from the FBI shows their suspect from the incident at the Lomas Starbucks. Officers also responded to the Gibson location in southeast Albuquerque. 
The FBI and the ATF are investigating the small devices left at the coffee shops. APD is assisting in the investigation. 
APD was unable to say whether the devices went off inside or outside the building. They did send out their bomb squad to the scene Friday. 
Many people in the area surrounding these Starbucks were put on high alert after the incident saying those detonations were loud enough for them to hear. 
Employees at a store near one of the affected locations say they’re shocked someone would do something like this on a busy day like Black Friday. 
If you have any information, you’re asked to call the Albuquerque FBI branch. 3 #ABQ Starbucks vandalized, suspicious devices found. Photo of suspect released. If you have info call #FBI 505-889-1300. pic.twitter.com/UJ1VfTbqcc 
— FBI Albuquerque (@FBIAlbuquerque) November 25, 2016 Heavy police presence at the Starbucks at Central and Tulane. Police tape surrounding area. pic.twitter.com/c55zVEjfp2 
— Sara Yingling (@KRQE_Yingling) November 25, 2016 This Starbucks at Lomas and Washington is closed for now. pic.twitter.com/bTkDregJTH 
— Sara Yingling (@KRQE_Yingling) November 25, 2016 Doors and windows were broken. Glass shattered everywhere. pic.twitter.com/F64rINdDHU 
— Sara Yingling (@KRQE_Yingling) November 25, 2016 ❯❯ Click the Icon below to share this post...

posts.author: Sienna Fantozzi
posts.title: Everything You Need to Know About Starbucks' New Holday Menu
posts.text:
Everything You Need to Know About Starbucks' New Holday Menu Delish 3 hrs ago Sienna Fantozzi © Courtesy of Starbucks Everything You Need to Know About Starbucks' New Holday Menu Now that we finally know Starbucks' 2016 holiday cup design , it's time to start thinking about the holiday menu. In addition to all those red-cupped peppermint mochas and gingerbread lattes, the coffee company is serving up some pretty tasty eats and treats, and you can definitely expect some new offerings this year.
We can always count on some staples from the Starbucks holiday line-up: cranberry bliss bars (which you can buy by the case to truly fuel that addiction), that adorbs frosted snowman cookie, and the gingerbread loaf, and all of those are of course there and accounted for, but this year we've also got a few new items to get excited about.
© Provided by Delish As far as baked goods go, expect to see the cranberry bliss bar, frosted snowman cookie, holiday ugly sweater cookie, gingerbread loaf, peppermint brownie cake pop, and a snowman cake pop. They will also be offering two new sandwiches, including the All The Trimmings Breakfast Sandwich (maple-glazed ham, an apple sausage patty, apple-sage stuffing, and savory maple glaze on a buttery bun) and a Carved Ham, Egg, and Swiss Breakfast Sandwich on a croissant. While the croissant will be available in most stores across the U.S., the All The Trimmings sandwich will only be offered in Seattle, Florida, and some stores in California. But on the bright side-you can ease your sandwich suffering with the returning classic Holiday Turkey and Stuffing Panini.
© Provided by Delish Follow Delish on Instagram .

thread.title: FBI: Three Starbucks vandalized, suspicious devices found
thread.title_full: FBI: Three Starbucks vandalized, suspicious devices found

posts.title: FBI: Three Starbucks vandalized, suspicious devices found
posts.text:
FBI: Three Starbucks vandalized, suspicious devices found 
J.R. Oppenheim November 25, 2016 08:38 AM 
During an investigation into vandalism overnight, authorities said Friday morning they found suspicious devices at three Starbucks locations in Albuquerque. Advertisement 
FBI Media Coordinator Frank Fisher said the devices were placed at the coffee shops on 3400 Central Ave., 4407 Lomas Blvd. and 5401 Gibson Blvd. The stores were closed at the time. Fisher did not elaborate what those devices were, but he said one caused minimal damage. 
There were no injuries reported. 
Surveillance image from the Starbucks location on Lomas Boulevard. FBI 
Surveillance image from the Starbucks location on Lomas Boulevard. FBI Previous Next 
All three locations saw police presence for several hours. The FBI is serving as the lead investigator and receiving assistance from the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives along with the Albuquerque Police Department and the Albuquerque Fire Department. 
The FBI released two photos from the break-in at the Lomas location. In the video, a suspect wearing all black appears to be carrying something after breaking through the front door. There was no immediate information regarding that suspect. 
Contact FBI investigators with any information at (505)889-1300 or online at tips.fbi.gov . Credits Updated: November 25, 2016 08:38 AM Created: November 25, 2016 06:16 AM Copyright 2016 KOB-TV LLC, a Hubbard Broadcasting Company. All rights reserved Advertisement

thread.section_title: Nob Hill businesses push forward despite 2 suspicious fires and vandalism – KRQE News 13
thread.title: Nob Hill businesses push forward despite 2 suspicious fires and vandalism
thread.title_full: Nob Hill businesses push forward despite 2 suspicious fires and vandalism

posts.author: Rebecca Atkins
posts.title: Nob Hill businesses push forward despite 2 suspicious fires and vandalism
posts.text:
ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. (KRQE)- Broken glass and bullet holes are what’s left behind at the Starbucks on Central Avenue. One of three Starbucks locations targeted in the city early Friday morning.
A Starbucks on Lomas, and another on Gibson also suffered major damage from vandals that broke into the coffee shops. Albuquerque police have released a photo of the suspect, but the FBI has now taken over the investigation.
This is just the latest in a series of suspicious events in Nob Hill in recent days. A fire left devastating damage at The Carlisle , a new building full of condos that was expected to open next month.
A pro-life ministry was also the victim of a damaging fire on San Mateo.
“I just thought, more of the same,” said a man who works at Red Wings, looking at the scene outside the Starbucks on Central early Friday morning.
Many people in Nob Hill are fed up with the recent events, especially with the neighborhood already facing challenges from the Albuquerque Rapid Transit project.
“We had the fire two blocks down the street last week, that’s all blocked off and then this,” said the Red Wings employee.
But plenty of shop owners in Nob Hill are trying to stay optimistic as they gear up for the holidays.
“We just are not letting anything get us down,” said Michele Schuch the owner of Schushop on Carlisle.
Schuch’s business looks onto The Carlisle project that was burned to a crisp.
“My business is my livelihood, so I look at it like, I don’t have a choice, I’m not going to complain, I try to remain positive,” said Schuch.
The staff at Ooh Aah in Nob Hill said what keeps them going, “Honestly, it’s our customers,” said Dallas Ulibarri, the store’s manager. She said the fires and the vandalism is something they’ll move past.
“When ART started, we had customers come in and they would say, ‘we’re coming because we wanna see you survive everything that’s happening in the neighborhood,” said Ulibarri.
But, no matter what, Ulibariri said as a business and a community, they know they’ll be okay.
“I think it takes a lot for this neighborhood to get knocked down.”

thread.title_full: Starbucks' (SBUX) Initiatives Impress, Macro Woes Remain

posts.title: Starbucks' (SBUX) Initiatives Impress, Macro Woes Remain
posts.text:
Starbucks' (SBUX) Initiatives Impress, Macro Woes Remain November 24, 2016, 06:33:00 AM EDT By Zacks Equity Research, Zacks.com Shutterstock photo 
On Nov 22, we issued an updated research report on coffee chain giant Starbucks Corporation SBUX . Starbucks' shares have lost approximately 1.2% year to date due to several macro issues. Although the stock has partially recovered, it lags the broader market. Pros Starbucks is one of the most recognized coffee brands in the world. From espresso to specialty roast and ground coffee to premium single-serve market, Starbucks enjoys a leading position in all coffee segments. It is the number one premium packaged coffee brand in America. Further, management focuses on increasing its global market share through store openings in new and existing markets, remodeling of existing stores, deploying technology, controlling costs and aggressive product innovation and brand building. Recently, Starbucks concluded fiscal 2016 on a solid note. The company reported better-than-expected results in the fourth quarter with earnings and revenues increasing 30.2% and 16% year over year, respectively, buoyed by strong sales and margin expansion (up 180 basis points or bps). Higher sales in the U.S. and China/Asia Pacific division have counterbalanced a slowdown in the Europe, Middle East, and Africa ("EMEA") segment. Starbucks is working on technological innovation to strengthen its brand, improve efficiency and in-store execution and boost profits. Its Mobile Order & Pay service now represents nearly 6% of the total U.S. transactions as of Oct 2, 2016, up from 5% in the prior quarter. The Mobile Order & Pay service allows customers to order before arriving at a Starbucks café and pick up the items at the store, thus saving on time. The service is witnessing increased usage and could prove to be a key growth driver going ahead. Starbucks has also deployed the facility in many of its stores in the U.K. and Canada with plans to continue rolling out the platform in key international markets. Again, Starbucks' Channel Development or CPG business has become a fast growing and highly profitable business. This segment's operating margin rose 390 bps in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2016. Cons Economic, geopolitical and consumer headwinds continue to impact Starbucks' results. Meanwhile, the company's EMEA segment has been experiencing sluggish performance. During the fourth quarter, Starbucks posted negative 1% comp growth in the EMEA region and a 12% decline in revenues due to the ongoing macro and consumer challenges, and a shift toward more licensed stores along with currency headwinds. Comparable store sales or comps were flat in fiscal 2016 versus 4% growth in fiscal 2015. In Europe, economic/political conditions are anticipated to be challenging after U.K.'s exit from the 28-member economic bloc. As it is, business in Europe is clouded by the economic uncertainties in the Northern region and deflation in the Eurozone. High inflation rates and currency devaluation are hurting sales in Latin America, especially Brazil and Argentina. Moreover, the slowing down of the Chinese economy and concerns about Japan, owing to a weaker yen and tax increases, are adding to the restaurateurs' woes. Zacks Rank & Key Picks Starbucks carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). Better-ranked stocks in the restaurant space include The Cheesecake Factory Incorporated CAKE , Darden Restaurants, Inc. DRI and McDonald's Corporation MCD . All three companies carry a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy). You can see the complete list of today's Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks here . Darden Restaurants' current year growth rate is pegged at 10.9% while that for Cheesecake Factory is 19.5% and McDonald's is 14%. posts.author: Oliver Gettell
posts.title: Millie Bobby Brown parodies Adele's Hello while singing Starbucks order | EW.com
posts.text:
Posted November 25 2016 — 9:28 PM EST See also Eleven from 'Stranger Things' crushes Nicki Minaj's 'Monster' verse 
Hello from the Upside Down. 
Stranger Things star Millie Bobby Brown livened up a recent trip through the Starbucks drive-thru with her dad by singing her order in a parody of Adele’s “Hello.” In a video she posted to Twitter on Friday, Brown can be seen leaning over from the passenger seat and belting out, “Can I have a venti latte / And a caramel frappuccino? / Oh please!” 
Although she’s best known for playing a psychokinetic preteen on Netflix’s hit sci-fi series, Brown is no stranger to rocking the mic. She has a history of winning the internet with her fun videos by performing hits by artists such as Adele and Beyoncé, and she once demonstrated on The Tonight Show that she can rap Nicki Minaj’s “Monster” verse with aplomb. 
— Millie Bobby Brown (@milliebbrown) November 26, 2016 
Check out her Adele parody above.

posts.title: Millie Bobby Brown and her dad had a Starbucks misadventure you have to watch
posts.text: Millie Bobby Brown and her dad had a Starbucks misadventure you have to watch Brittany Boyd More In case you’ve managed to miss it, Netflix is BOOMING . From Black Mirror to Grace & Frankie and everything in between, Netflix is churning out fan favorites like some “I was glued to my couch for nine hours straight and didn’t mind” butter. And if the constantly developing storylines and creative cinematography aren’t enough to pull you in, the cast of these shows are entertaining beyond belief. In particular, the predominantly preteen and teenage cast from Stranger Things has everyone redefining squad goals. Why? Becase they’re not only great actors, they also pull some hilarious antics. Millie Bobby Brown can throw down with some Nicki Minaj. And you better believe that the kids have some mind-blowing dance moves . If you want to see more than her insane rapping skills, Millie’s Instagram is the place to be . In one of her latest videos, she shares a Starbucks misadventure which features her dad. “This is Panera, you plum.” Despite going to the wrong place at first, the pair made their way to Starbucks to get their caffeine fix for the day. But, being the eccentric soul that she is, Millie ordered for herself and her dad in the stylings of Adele. Embarrassment aside (ahem — hiding in the back seat), we’re sure that Millie still enjoyed her drink!

thread.title: FBI: Person connected to suspicious devices found at 3 Starbucks taken into custody
thread.title_full: FBI: Person connected to suspicious devices found at 3 Starbucks taken into custody

posts.author: Kayla Root
posts.title: FBI: Person connected to suspicious devices found at 3 Starbucks taken into custody
posts.text:
ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. (KRQE) – The FBI says they now have a person is in custody in connection with the investigation into several suspicious devices in Albuquerque.
The Albuquerque Police Department took the person into custody Saturday morning and turned the person over to the FBI.
Suspicious devices were planted at three Starbucks Coffee Shops in Albuquerque early Friday morning, one of which exploded.
The Starbucks on Central near Tulane in Nob Hill is one of the coffee shops that was hit. Another about a mile away on Lomas and the third on Gibson near San Mateo were also involved.
The FBI says no charges have been filed at this time, and the investigation by federal and Albuquerque law enforcement is ongoing.
There has been a series of suspicious events around Albuquerque in recent days, including a fire that left damage at The Carlisle , a new building full of condos that was expected to open next month, a pro-life ministry that was also set on fire on San Mateo, and two department stores that went up in flames on Saturday morning.
Police have not released any information on if the person in custody is connected to any of these fires or if there is any connection between them at all.

posts.title: Stranger Things' Eleven annoys a Starbucks employee
posts.text: When it comes to switching up a drive-thru order, major kudos goes to Stranger Things' Millie Bobby-Brown, who turned the process into a musical extravaganza. We already know she could rap, thanks to that awesome 'Monster' cover she did on The Tonight Show, but thanks to a recent social media post, we now know Eleven can SANNGGG as well. Exactly like another British sweetheart who has become a major sensation Stateside... Millie was with her dad at a Starbucks drive-thru when she went to order a large latte and a caramel frappuccino. So far so normal, right? Only, this time, she decided to mix 'Things' up, by singing her order to the tune of Adele's hit 'Hello'. Have we seen a 'Stranger Thing'? Probably not, but remind us to try this with our next Chicken Legend order because the results would probably be hilarious. Adventures at Starbucks with my daddy #hellofromtheupsidedown #keepcalmimparked #fatheranddaughterbanter @adele A video posted by Millie Bobby Brown (@milliebobby_brown) on Nov 25, 2016 at 5:07pm PST In the video, Millie can be seen leaning over her dad to deliver the vocally-tight-if-bizarre request. "Hello from the UPSIIDDEE DOOWNNN," sang Millie, "Can I have a venti latte / And a caramel frappuccino? / Oh please!" Her dad then stopped the singing and confirmed the order, before telling Millie that the unsuspecting drive-thru employee is probably not a fan. "She nearly shut the window, that's how much she hates ya," said Millie's dad. "Yeah she don't like ya." LOL. No worries, Mills, we're totally fans here at Digital Spy, and the incident has got us thinking about more Adele food-related covers, such as 'When We Were Young Hungry' and 'Rolling in the (Maccie) D's'. Want up-to-the-minute entertainment and tech news? Just hit 'Like' on our Digital Spy Facebook page and 'Follow' on our @digitalspy Twitter account and you're all set.

thread.title_full: Everything You Need to Know About Starbucks' New Holiday Menu

posts.author: Sienna Fantozzi
posts.title: Everything You Need to Know About Starbucks' New Holiday Menu
posts.text:
Everything You Need to Know About Starbucks' New Holiday Menu Delish 1 day ago Sienna Fantozzi © Courtesy of Starbucks Everything You Need to Know About Starbucks' New Holday Menu Now that we finally know Starbucks' 2016 holiday cup design , it's time to start thinking about the holiday menu. In addition to all those red-cupped peppermint mochas and gingerbread lattes, the coffee company is serving up some pretty tasty eats and treats, and you can definitely expect some new offerings this year.
We can always count on some staples from the Starbucks holiday line-up: cranberry bliss bars (which you can buy by the case to truly fuel that addiction), that adorbs frosted snowman cookie, and the gingerbread loaf, and all of those are of course there and accounted for, but this year we've also got a few new items to get excited about.
© Provided by Delish As far as baked goods go, expect to see the cranberry bliss bar, frosted snowman cookie, holiday ugly sweater cookie, gingerbread loaf, peppermint brownie cake pop, and a snowman cake pop. They will also be offering two new sandwiches, including the All The Trimmings Breakfast Sandwich (maple-glazed ham, an apple sausage patty, apple-sage stuffing, and savory maple glaze on a buttery bun) and a Carved Ham, Egg, and Swiss Breakfast Sandwich on a croissant. While the croissant will be available in most stores across the U.S., the All The Trimmings sandwich will only be offered in Seattle, Florida, and some stores in California. But on the bright side-you can ease your sandwich suffering with the returning classic Holiday Turkey and Stuffing Panini.
© Provided by Delish Follow Delish on Instagram .

thread.title_full: One in Custody After Devices Put in 3 Albuquerque Starbucks

posts.author: Katelyn Stark
posts.title: One in Custody After Devices Put in 3 Albuquerque Starbucks
posts.text:
(CNN) — One person is in custody after three Starbucks coffee shops were vandalized in Albuquerque, according to the Federal Bureau of Investigation.
Suspicious devices were placed at the stores early Friday. One went off and caused minimal damage, the FBI’s local office tweeted.
All three stores were closed at the time and no one was injured, the FBI said.
The person in custody has not been named, and no motive has been given.
The FBI, Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives and the Albuquerque police and fire departments are investigating.
A Starbucks spokesperson told CNN the company was working closely with investigating authorities. “We are relieved that the stores were closed at the time of the incidents, and there are no reports of any injuries,” the spokesperson said.
CNN affiliate KOAT is reporting that multiple incidents, including a fire early Saturday at an Old Navy, may be connected.

thread.title: ‘Stranger Things’ Eleven Sings Her Starbucks Order To Adele
thread.title_full: ‘Stranger Things’ Eleven Sings Her Starbucks Order To Adele

posts.author: Jovi Figueroa
posts.title: ‘Stranger Things’ Eleven Sings Her Starbucks Order To Adele
posts.text:
Young star Millie Bobby Brown behind Stranger Things ‘ Eleven is incredibly funny in real life—and singing her Starbucks order to Adele’s Hello is only one of her many hilarious skits.
Millie Bobby Brown is an astounding actress, as we have seen in her flawless and spine-tingling portrayal of Eleven in hit Netflix series Stranger Things. If you’ve been following Bobby Brown on TV and on the internet, then you’re sure no stranger to her hilarious things (get the pun? of course!). Bobby Brown has appeared in various television shows since Stranger Things took off and has been very active on her social media accounts, too.
Love and light ???? pic.twitter.com/o0Zlp6hU7v 
— Millie Bobby Brown (@milliebbrown) November 24, 2016 
If you haven’t been following the Stranger Things actress on Instagram (why?!) or just failed to check her out this week, then you must know she’s up to some terribly hilarious things again. This time pulling pranks with her dad, Digital Spy reports that our favorite Eleven is showcasing her mad voice skills again—but this time, on a Starbucks drive-thru. Basically just another normal day for the very normal Millie Bobby Brown. Millie revealed earlier that she started loving singing at a very young age.
The Instagram video shows the young Stranger Things star with her dad, going through a Starbucks drive-thru window. Millie then leans over her dad to get closer to the window and belt out her coffee orders to the tune of Adele’s record-breaking Hello. Her coffee song goes:
Hello from the UPSIIDDEE DOOWNNN~
Can I have a venti latte / And a caramel frappuccino? / Oh please!
Millie’s dad then cuts her and confirms the order to the Starbucks barista, who seems like she doesn’t recognize the young star from Stranger Things at all! If Millie Bobby Brown’s coffee song was not strange enough, then there’s definitely no stranger thing than someone not knowing about Stranger Things’ Eleven! She’s basically everywhere, these days (especially last Halloween)!
Millie’s dad then teases her:
She nearly shut the window, that’s how much she hates you. Yeah, she don’t like you.
Watching the video for the first time gave me so much chills—one because Millie trying so hard is so hilarious; and two, because her voice is just phenomenal. See for yourself in the video below:
Adventures at Starbucks with my daddy #hellofromtheupsidedown #keepcalmimparked #fatheranddaughterbanter @adele 
A video posted by Millie Bobby Brown (@milliebobby_brown) on Nov 25, 2016 at 5:07pm PST 

Millie Bobby Brown is hilarious hands down, and the Stranger Things star would constantly post on Instagram her many adventures. In two more of Bobby Brown’s Instagram videos, she showcases her dancing skills.
In one video, she is dancing with Todrick Hall to Ariana Grande’s Into You. In the other one, we see her trying for a pun, where our Stranger Things’ Eleven dances to Beyoncé’s 7/11.
(null) (made by @ milliebrown70 with @musical.ly) ♬ Into You – Ariana Grande . #musicallyapp #ArianaGrande #IntoYou #music #musicvideo #musical #musica #followme #bestoftheday #instadaily with my fave @todrick 
A video posted by Millie Bobby Brown (@milliebobby_brown) on Oct 24, 2016 at 6:57pm PDT 

Being 12 is so much fun! ❤️ #younglife #youthful #embrace 
A video posted by Millie Bobby Brown (@milliebobby_brown) on Sep 5, 2016 at 9:41pm PDT 

Here’s also another video where Millie tries to channel her inner Stranger Things’ Eleven to skip having to do the push ups her trainer asks her to do.
Eleven in the gym with her powers! #Mark #boxingrules #strangerthings @phoenixmma_bournemouth 
A video posted by Millie Bobby Brown (@milliebobby_brown) on Aug 25, 2016 at 5:23am PDT 

Millie Bobby Brown has gone through so much ever since her role as Eleven in Stranger Things and with that huge talent of hers and her even bigger heart, she is poised to take over Hollywood in no time.
Season 2 of Stranger Things have already been confirmed and while Eleven was blasted off to magic dust in the last season, we know she’s coming back in season 2, Inquisitr reports. We have no idea, at the moment, however, in what form does Eleven come back in season 2 of Stranger Things, or if she’s being renewed as a season regular at all. Well we do know that one of the biggest selling points of Stranger Things remains to be Eleven so it’s unwise for the Duffer brothers to not give her the exposure time she deserves.
011 is back! It's official, can't wait to be back working with this lovely cast again for #strangerthings thank you to the amazing duffer brothers for having el back for a second season!❤️ 
A photo posted by Millie Bobby Brown (@milliebobby_brown) on Nov 4, 2016 at 10:32am PDT 

Season 2 of Stranger Things will hope to uncover more about the upside down, about Eleven’s powers, and about Will possibly carrying a Demogorgon inside of him (as teased in the last episode of last season). It’s scheduled to release around July of 2017.
In the meantime, you can watch more hilarious moments of Stranger Things’ Eleven in the video below.
[Featured image by Mike Coppola/Getty Images]
‘Stranger Things’ Eleven Sings Her Starbucks Order To Adele is an article from: The Inquisitr News

thread.title: One held after suspicious devices found at 3 Starbucks in Albuquerque
thread.title_full: One held after suspicious devices found at 3 Starbucks in Albuquerque - UPI.com

posts.author: upi.com
posts.title: One held after suspicious devices found at 3 Starbucks in Albuquerque
posts.text:
ALBUQUERQUE, Nov. 27 (UPI) -- One person is in custody after suspicious devices were found at three vandalized Starbucks, including one that detonated and caused minimal damage to a franchise in southeast Albuquerue.
The FBI announced the arrest Saturday after the incidents occurred early Friday.
The FBI, Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives, and the Albuquerque Police and Fire Departments are investigating. The individual arrested hasn't been named.
Before the arrest, the FBI released photos from surveillance video of a suspect involved in the incident at one of the stores.
All three stores have since reopened, despite multiple windows having apparent bullet holes.
Glass doors at some of the locations were shattered.
"We heard gunshots go off. At least four rounds of gunshots go off, and then we heard a large explosion," a witness who lives near the Starbucks in Albuquerque's Nob Hill told KOAT-TV . "It was like a big flash -- like, orange and white -- just smoke everywhere."
Another witness said he saw a person get into a car and drive away.
"We saw an individual approach the Starbucks before the explosion, and he threw something towards the window, and then the explosion went off," said the witness.
Two other suspicious fires occurred in the area earlier in the week.
After new condominiums went up in flames, Albuquerque firefighters called the incident suspicious. The FBI is also looking into another fire around the same time at a pro-life ministry.

thread.title: Don’t Get Scrooged This Christmas: How To Decorate on a Budget
thread.title_full: Don’t Get Scrooged This Christmas: How To Decorate on a Budget

posts.author: SMU Contributor
posts.title: Don’t Get Scrooged This Christmas: How To Decorate on a Budget
posts.text:
snow Share this article 
With Starbucks releasing their red Christmas cups and Dedman playing Christmas music, it appears that the holidays have begun. Whether you agree “the most wonderful time of the year” has begun or you believe the holidays are still around the corner, we all start to anticipate budgeting our money on gifts, celebrations, and of course, decorations. But there is no need to tap into that gift giving fund in order to make your home look the part this year. With these easy and affordable decorations, your house (or dorm room!) will look just as cheerful as your bank account. 
We understand that you cannot deck out every inch of the house for the holidays like the inhabitants of Whoville in “The Grinch,” so pick main spots you or guests will see the most. Decorate main entrances with cutouts of snowflakes tied to string, a single role of white streamers or festive white lights that can be found on Amazon for only $8.99! 
Do not be a “cotton headed ninnny muggins” this year. Take Buddy the Elf’s strategy and utilize edible decorations from the four main food groups: “Candy, candy canes, candy corn, and syrup.” We suggest filling festive colored bowls with candy, spreading red and green salt water taffies across a table, or tying candy canes to a continuous string and displaying them across a plain wall or fire place. 
We all have seen “Christmas Vacation” and understand that not every house is meant to fit a tree. But the holiday must go on, so take some festive gold and green ribbon, sticky tape or tacks, and follow a zig zag pattern along a wall to create the image of a tree. If you want to continue “Rocking Around the Christmas Tree” tack up all your friend’s Christmas cards along the ribbon as ornaments, or string some lights along the wall for some sparkle. If you create your tree in an area with plenty of space, place any wrapped presents you have along the base of the wall, under your tree. 
Don’t have wall space? Then bring the outdoors in with a simple yard search and some green paint. Simply find pinecones and paint them green with a paintbrush or simply dip the entire pinecone in paint, let it dry, and there you have it: mini Christmas trees to display anywhere from the dinner table to the bathroom counter. If you have extra time, make it a “White Christmas” and add some white paint to the tips, or dash some silver sparkles on the tips of each pinecone. 
Turn any average white door or fridge into Frosty the Snowman with some paper and scissors. Cut two large black circles for eyes, five smaller circles to form a mouth, and three additional small circles for the buttons on his stomach. Duct tape the circles on the door as they would appear on any snowman and cut out an orange triangle for his nose. If you want to be on Santa’s Nice List, you should finish off the look by cutting one long strip of red or green paper, and two smaller strips that make a scarf to keep your snowman looking sharp. 
Let more than Rudoplh’s nose shine bright this Christmas and add some sugar and spice to items already in your home. Fill any candle holders or clear jars with raw cranberries or other red items. This will add a festive look to any table without screaming “Santa’s coming!” 
If you have any trees in your front yard or plants within your home, instantly create a “Winter Wonderland” by hanging traditional plastic ornaments off branches. Cheap ornaments can be found in Target, Walmart, or any basic drugstore for as little as $5 per package. Feeling naughty? Get messy by purchasing clear ornaments, and filling them with paint to create your own, uniquely designed Christmas decorations. 
With these easy, budget friendly decorating ideas, it is impossible to not get involved in the holiday cheer. Whether you have already embraced the Christmas spirit or plan to hold off until December, remember than you do not have to break the bank to make your home look Martha Stewart worthy this holiday season. Just make sure your guests do not get their tinsel in a tangle when they realize how easy it was to turn your home into Santa’s workshop. You Might Also Enjoy

posts.text:
COMMENTS JasonÂ LaVeris/FilmMagic Millie Bobby Brown attends the premiere of "Stranger Things" at Mack Sennett Studios on July 11, 2016 in Los Angeles.Â 
Millie Bobby Brown, best known for her role as Eleven in the Netflix series Stranger Things , showed off her vocal talent in a silly clip from the Starbucks drive-thru. The young actress shared a video of herself belting out a coffee order in the style of Adele's "Hello." 
“Can I have a venti latte / And a caramel frappuccino? / Oh, please!” she can be heard singing below, swapping her words in place of the original lyric, "Hello from the other side / I must have called a thousand times / To tell you...," and then covering her face as though in disbelief she actually did it. 
It's unclear how the Starbucks employee reacted to the serenade, since she seemed focused on just trying to make sure she heard the order correctly. 
Check out the spontaneous performance.

posts.title: Starbucks Just Released a Cup That Will Prevent Your Coffee From Going Cold Ever Again
posts.text:
Starbucks Just Released a Cup That Will Prevent Your Coffee From Going Cold Ever Again PopSugar 9 hrs ago Terry Carter © Provided by PopSugar What Is the Ember Mug?
Say goodbye to lukewarm Pumpkin Spice Lattes this Winter. Starbucks has teamed up with Ember, the company behind the Ember Mug , a smartphone-controlled coffee mug designed to keep your coffee heated to your desired temperature all day long.
According to Inc., the cup works by using " a series of sensors and heating rings " that will warm up your drink - or cool it down, if you'd prefer. To control the temperature, all you have to do is rotate the dial located on the bottom of the mug. You can also control how warm your coffee stays using the Ember app. Once connected to your smartphone or smartwatch device, you can change the temperature of the liquid inside of your Ember cup with just a tap on your screen.
Starbucks "ran the mugs through months of safety inspections" before agreeing to allow the product to be sold in its stores, Inc. reported. The chain also reportedly tested the mug to make sure the heating process "didn't change the flavor of its coffee." The Ember Mug is currently listed for $150 and is available for purchase in 100 Starbucks locations throughout the US. Get a closer look at the brand-new smart mug ahead. Would you invest in a cup that promises to keep your coffee warm all day long?

thread.title: 'Stranger Things' star Millie Bobby Brown sings her order at Starbucks in Adele style
thread.title_full: 'Stranger Things' star Millie Bobby Brown sings her order at Starbucks in Adele style

posts.title: 'Stranger Things' star Millie Bobby Brown sings her order at Starbucks in Adele style
posts.text:
0 2016Actors Gaten Matarazzo (L), Caleb McLaughlin and Millie Bobby Brown from the Netflix series "Stranger Things" arrive at the 68th Primetime Emmy Awards in Los Angeles, California U.S., September 18, 2016. Reuters/Lucy Nicholson 
Millie Bobby Brown sang out her order at Starbucks in Adele style in the video clip she posted on Twitter on Nov. 25. The "Stranger Things" star was sitting on the passenger seat when she leaned over to the side of the drive-thru attendant. She ordered a venti latte and a caramel frappuccino belting out to the tune of "Hello." 
“Can I have a venti latte / And a caramel frappuccino? / Oh, please!”/"Hello from the other side / I must have called a thousand times / To tell you...," Brown belted out the song. 
— Millie Bobby Brown (@milliebbrown) November 26, 2016 
The 12-year-old actress has also posted several videos of herself singing Beyoncé and Nicki Minaj's songs. Brown's videos showed that she has the talent in singing and completely different from the role she played in the American science fiction-horror web television series. She loves to sing Adele and Amy Winehouse's song but her favourite artist is Ed Sheeran. 
Millie Bobby Brown in "Stranger Things" 
Brown played small roles in "Modern Family" and "Grey's Anatomy." However, the actress' family decided to move back to England to stay with her aunt. The roles she played wasn't enough to make her family stay in the US. Then she got an invitation to audition for the role of Eleven in the series. She auditioned using dummy slides using fake scenes to test the ability of an actor without giving away the plot of the story. She obviously got the role but she didn't know anything about her character. 
Brown's role as Eleven is dark, broody and hardly loquacious type. She mostly shows her emotions and speaks few words. . 
"Stranger Things" Season 2 News and Update 
In the second installment of "Stranger Things," Brown's character, Eleven, is coming back. There are new actors joining the next season, including Sadie Sink, Dacre Montgomery and Brett Gelman. Sink will play a tomboyish new girl in town named Max. Montgomery will play a friendly-with-ladies bad boy named Billy, playing Max's step brother. Gelman will play Murray Bauman, a former journalist passionate with conspiracy theories. The show is expected to air before July 2017.

thread.title: Readers turn up for free green tea lattes and to meet food writers at Starbucks Wheelock Place

posts.title: Readers turn up for free green tea lattes and to meet food writers at Starbucks Wheelock Place
posts.text:
ePaper Readers turn up for free green tea lattes and to meet food writers at Starbucks Wheelock Place Father and son, Kelvin and Ken Chan, ask Straits Times Life Editor, Tan Hsueh Yun to autograph their free Cook Mee cookbook that was presented to them this morning (Nov 28). ST PHOTO: REBECCA LYNNE TAN Readers of The Straits Times queuing up to collect their free green tea latte from Starbucks at Wheelock Place on Nov 28, 2016. ST PHOTO: REBECCA LYNNE TAN Published STrebeccatan 
SINGAPORE - Some Straits Times readers made their way down to Starbucks at Wheelock Place bright and early on Monday morning (Nov 28) before 8am for free green tea latte and to meet Straits Times' food writers Tan Hsueh Yun and Wong Ah Yoke. 
The first readers arrived at about 7.30am. Among them was retiree Frances Yong, 64, who had read about the website's launch in the paper last week. 
Madam Yong said: "I always go to ST for good food and for ideas on where to eat." 
Others who turned up include those who work in the Orchard and Newton area. 
Early birds were also presented with ST tumblers and notebooks, as well as copies of ST's instant noodle cookbook, Cook Mee. 
Manager Kelvin Chan, 49, and his son Ken, 16, a student, were excited to meet ST's food experts. 40658583_-_24_11_2016_-_pixst.jpg Related Story Meet Tan Hsueh Yun and Wong Ah Yoke on Nov 28; delicious daily giveaways by ST Food until Dec 2 
The older Mr Chan said: "I like that ST's food writers actually review the food. This gives us a better idea of what to expect. It is through their expertise that we learn to appreciate food better." 
There are a total of 500 cups of Starbucks Teavana Red Ribbon Green Tea Latte to be given away this morning at Starbucks outlets in the Orchard Road area. 
Drinks at Starbucks Wheelock Place have been fully redeemed but there are still limited cups available at Starbucks' four other participating outlets at The Centrepoint, Ion Orchard, Paragon Shopping Centre and Wisma Atria, as of 11.30am. 
The free drinks are the first of five days of giveaways, from today till Friday, as part of the launch of ST's new food website straitstimesfood.com.

posts.title: Comment on ‘Stranger Things’ Millie Bobby Brown Sings Adele At Starbucks Drive-Thru — Watch by Janine C. Boone
posts.text:
13 Photos Apparently when Millie Bobby Brown isn’t playing Eleven on Netflix’s hit series ‘Stranger Things,’ she’s doing epic covers of amazing songs in Starbucks drive-thrus. Who knew? Check out the video of Millie belting out her coffee order set to Adele’s ‘Hello’ right here. 
Stranger Things star Millie Bobby Brown said “Hi” from the Upside Down on a trip through a Starbucks drive-thru with her dad when she sang out her order in a parody of of Adele ’s “Hello.” In the clip she posted to Twitter on Nov. 25, Millie is seen leaning over from the passenger seat to serenade the drive-thru attendant with her order, “Can I have a venti latte / And a caramel frappuccino? / Oh please!” OMG Millie, how we love you. 
The 12-year-old actress is best known for playing Eleven, a psychokinetic preteen on the hit Netflix series . But that doesn’t mean she doesn’t take every opportunity she gets to prove she’s got some musical chops too! In fact she’s posted several videos of herself performing hits by Adele and Beyoncé . She even epically rapped Nicki Minaj ‘s “Monster” verse on The Tonight Show. ‘Stranger Things’ Season 1 Pics 
And Millie isn’t the only Stranger Things kid who knows how to rock a rhyme. Gatten Matarazzo , 14, starred in a recent Old Navy video that was a parody of a Technotronic’s 1989 music video for “Pump Up The Jam.” In the retro-style video, Gaten was seen getting down to the song and rapping in front of an animated backdrop. It was seriously hilarious and we absolutely love that all of these kids know how to have fun and get down to the beat. Though, with the seriousness of the show, we doubt we’re gonna see them singing in the series any time soon. But you never know! 
HollywoodLifers , did you love Millie’s rendition of “Hello”? Are you a huge Millie fan? Let us know below! More 'Stranger Things' News:

posts.text:
How Do You Compare to the Competition? Get facts about other applicants with a CareerBuilder Account Job Description Grade: Exhibit proper knowledge, selling techniques and service delivery of all items on the menu as well as prepare and serve food & beverage items to guest as necessary. Expedite the order in an accurate and timely manner and having the ability to recognize quality of the product while adhering to all Starbucks and Company standards. Anticipate the guests' needs and respond appropriately with a sense of urgency before leaving the counter. Take and input orders into POS system, receive payment and make proper change, complete required transactions, and categorize tendered receipts by media type. Maintain the cleanliness and the appearance of the front and dining area. Greet guests in a positive, friendly manner and making them feel welcome; address the guest by their name if known or by “sir” or “ma’am”. Ask guest for additional needs and complying with any special requests. Consistently follow sequence of service utilizing proper procedures standardized by department. Itemize bills correctly and efficiently secure payment. Communicate well in professional manner with the kitchen staff about food orders. Pack the orders as per guests' preference and complete the order with any necessary condiments. Bid farewell to guests, using guest's name when known, and encourage them to return. Must adhere to Starbucks Standards and Company Standards. Perform all opening and closing duties based upon shift assignment. Refill ice coolers, reach-in beverage coolers, reach-in pantry coolers and condiment drawer. Refill pastry and food cases and maintain its cleanliness. Stock the front line with supplies necessary for service. Clear tables and counters; sweep and maintain the cleanliness of the dining area without interfering with the comfort of guests. Maintain the cleanliness of the back area and all the storage areas. Maintain cleanliness and stock of assigned areas, side stations, tables and POS stations. Maintain a level of professionalism that will make guests want to return to the outlet. Follow the Department standard in opening and closing the restaurant. Follow the Department policy on cash handling. Unload warehouse orders and stock the orders to designated storage maintaining organization. Effectively communicate with management, chefs and culinary staff in order to fulfill and address any issues or needs requested by guests and or other employees. Inspect the food coming from support departments to ensure freshness and quality. Properly label and date all products for safe keeping and sanitation. Work as a team, assisting all guests' and employees' needs and inquiries. Follow all procedures and policies set forth by the company, division and department. Follow all health and safety regulations. Perform other job related duties as assigned. 
Required: At least 1 year of experience as a food handler in a similar, high-volume, fast paced restaurant environment. At least 1 year of guest service related experience. Ability to manage multiple tasks and remain calm in a very high paced and stressful environment. Basic computer skills and experience with POS systems. Working knowledge of different types of tendering guest checks and register functions. Knowledge of all beverage product, menu items and equipment used to perform these duties and ability to speak confidently and properly to serve such items. Knowledgeable about health and safety regulations. Ability to use standard kitchen equipment, including, but not limited to toasters, refrigerators/coolers, slicers, beverage machines. Excellent customer service skills. Have interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all business contacts. A highly motivated and energetic personality. Has ability to take initiative and exhibit flexibility Professional appearance and demeanor. Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays. High school diploma or equivalent. Able to effectively communicate in English, in both written and oral forms.
